channel.title: Quick command question
channel.description: Hey guys I want people to kill barrelchest for a bchest anchor but i only want someone to get it once so how could i make it so a play can put in a command only once...

item.title: Quick command question
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Let me explain my code
What it does is Checks if you Killed the Npc that drops the Item
Then it checks if your Npc has ever dropped the Item before For you
If so It wont roll
If it did not drop the item before you have a 10% chance to get the Item
You may change anything on here.
Please post if this is not what you were asking for.

I am unsure what you are asking but i will try to Be sure to post what i am hearing
This is assuming your using Delta sorry if your not
In the file
NpcHandler.java
Search for this

if (npcs[i].npcType == 2027) {
temp.Guthan = 1;
temp.Barrows += 1;
temp.isBG = false;
}

add this

if (npcs[i].npcType == NpcID) {
			if (temp.BarrelChest == 0) {
			int PercentChance = misc.random(99)+1;
			if  (PercentChance <= 10) {//Chance is //EDIT THE #### to dropId
		server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(p, (int) drops[NPCID][i],npc.absX, npc.absY,(int) ####, npc.getKiller());
                                      temp.BarrelChest = 1;
					}
					}

}

Now a save code for your Client.java

Search for

                                        } else if (token.equals("character-pkPoints")) {
						pkPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);

add

                                        } else if (token.equals("character-BarelDrp")) {
						BarrelChest = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Search for

			characterfile.write("character-pkPoints = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(pkPoints), 0, Integer.toString(pkPoints).length());
			characterfile.newLine();

add

			characterfile.write("character-BarelDrp = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(BarrelChest), 0, Integer.toString(BarrelChest).length());
			characterfile.newLine();

and Dont forget too add your

public int BarrelChest = 0;

put that with the rest of your public ints

Read full topic

item.title: Quick command question
item.dc:creator: @mages_pk_god mages pk god
item.description:
@mages_pk_god wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:373376”][quote author=jailed link=topic=469390.msg3431762#msg3431762 date=1292414426]
Just declare a new playersave… jeez.
Here is how the command could look like after you declared the playersave:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("bchest") && bchest == 0){ triggerTele(x, y, height); bchest += 1; }
[/quote]That’s called an integer, not a playersave.[/quote]
lol’d
but yeah create a new integer and declare a token int (that’s what it is on most 317 bases) of what you want it to precisely do when that integer changes to 1… the only trouble would be linking the npc drop to that token int?..

Read full topic

item.title: Quick command question
item.dc:creator: @Rickrolla Rickrolla
item.description:
@Rickrolla wrote:

Well, how about this:

You use barrelchest for a quest and a rare location.
Talking to a person which is related in the quest, will teleport you to that location.
Once the quest is completed he will say:

“You have already defeated barrelchest”

I can give you the code if you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick command question
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Just store an attribute in their character file specifying whether they’ve ever got one. I’m pretty sure that’s what the stater command does, or at least, what it used to do.

Read full topic
